caption: the pandemic has crippled this place...The good news is that they're trying to get back to what they were...I will definitely be back when that happens. Covid-19 has knocked so many things off the menu.
Very tasty recipes. Unique atmosphere.

It's rare to find a restaurant that meets the 5-Star rating for both ambiance, cocktails, and food. Fat Hen certainly deserves a 5-star rating for all. We love having this restaurant in our neighborhood and hope it remains a favorite for many years to come.
Totally fine! Hard to justify value for money though.
A dining experience like few others. Extravagant food and delightful service - couldn’t recommend this place highly enough.
One of the best meals two foodies have ever had. Service, apps, main course and dessert top notch. Don’t miss it.
(Translated by Google) Excellent!!!...  (Original) Excelente!!!...
Just super. Excellent food, imaginatively présentes, super service. Wonderful spot.
My favorite restaurant in the Boston area. I'm never disappointed. Staff is amazing, food is very thoughtfully put together, balanced, and all around delicious.
Food outstanding and personal service - warm and friendly.
Pleasant workers very nice
Excellent in all ways. Food and service were above anything I ever experienced. Thanks for the great evening!
Amazing quality food and Italian/French wines. A truly unique experience 10/10

What an absolute neighborhood gem. Wonderful space/ambience. Staff is over the top with courtesy and knowledge. Food was timed perfectly despite being there on a Saturday at peak time. The kitchen had it all under control and the servers made sure everything got where it was going on time. Speaking of the food...WOW....such a unique menu and very blatantly designed by a chef with years of education and experience. Each dish was a combination of opposing flavors which came together to create a perfect harmony. You don't create these type of dishes by chance...there is some serious skill in the kitchen at Fat Hen. Wine list was superb, signature cocktails looked amazing but the wine list honestly spoke to clearly to my heart that I had to opt for a paired four course dinner. I was not disappointed. Rib eye and the scallop crudo stood out, but it was all simply decadent. 10/10 will be back.
Prix Fixe was delicious. Try the risotto!
Amazing pre fixe small plates! Great service and great wine list.
Get the lamb Bolognese , so good
Amazing Brian and Jaime are the best. Food is to die for and quality for the price is insane. Do the chefs tasting.

I have to be honest, when I first saw the menu, I thought there were limited amount of items I could eat. Then I was told to give it a shot. We selected the 4 course option and asked them to pair the wine. The food was unbelievable. The selection of wine was outstanding. Above all, the staff is phenomenal. Our server had tons of positive energy. He presented everything to us that would make a seasoned advertising agent jealous. It was so obvious that he loves what he does. I highly recommend everyone to go and try this place out.
Did the prix fixe menu.  Pasta was my favorite but everything was great!

Fantastic! Beautiful dining room! KImdest & knowledgeable hospitality & food was just delicious. Gorgeous presentation, tasty vittles & magical wines. We're planning to go back many times & wishful for every success for you! Thanks!!!
Well organized, easy to book. The best part is the very real Italian food. My nonna who is from Italy and super hard to impress with Italian food loved it.

(Translated by Google) Very good attention. Contemporary Italian haute cuisine The Cesar salad different and first. You have to try it.  (Original) Muy buena atención. Alta cocina italiana contemporánea. La ensalada Cesar diferente y de primera. Hay que probarla.

Incredible food and great service! Ordered the chef's whim and thoroughly enjoyed every course. He came out to tell us about each plate and the timing between them was perfect. Would definitely recommend!
Very good food 👍
(Translated by Google) Okay  (Original) Bueno
Unbelievable food and service! Highly recommend the burrata.
Excellent.
Fantastic food and service, nice and cozy place. Highly recommended!!
Fantastic date night restaurant
Cool vibe, small menu, amazing pastas not to be missed
The wife suggested it, and Prix fixe with wine pairing did not disappoint.

Exceptional meal. I highly recommend the tasting menus. Everything we tried was so delicious and they do not skimp on the portions. you won't walk out feeling like a fat hen but you get the exact right amount to feel satisfied and like you got a good value. the 4 course menu at $55 dollars is by far the best deal. I recommend the Risotto, Croquettes, and scallops. Foie gras was the only thing that we found to be only okay (still good by any standards, but not amazing)

We had a lovely Valentine's dinner here with a pre-fixed  course menu. First few courses were really delicious.  I found the main course (chicken) tender and juicy but was less impressed compared you the other courses.   Dessert was delicious

What an amazing place. Our chef Ryan was fantastic. We did the chef's tasting menu, highly recommend it, which was also tailored to my wife's dietary restrictions perfectly and consideratly. This is a great place for micro Italian cuisine.
Top notch food and service.  Chef Brian Miller offers innovative and meticulously prepared dishes.  The eight course tasting menu was outstanding.  Will definitely be returning for more great food.

We had an AMAZING dinner here. Definitely recommend doing the chefs choice. Every single dish was explained to us by the chef who obviously put a lot of time and thought into the dishes. We both agreed that this was one of the best meals we've probably ever had. Certainly will be coming back.
Excellent Italian influenced food. Pricy wine selection.
very expensive had the six-course meal with the wine pairing, the best course was the pasta but it was a small portion. We left hungry.
Brought my wife, it was so so.  Went back by accident with in-laws and it was less so.  Waiter is a helpful guy, tho.
Innovative and inventive. Good wine pairings. Excellent service. Food is art here.
Food was amazing, but portions are on the smaller side. Luckily, the Prix fixe option is super worth it because you get to try so many delicious things

The food at Fat Hen is delicious, well-balanced and offers a great variety. It's also paired with exceptional service and attention to detail. Having said that I would not call this an Italian restaurant. I came wanting to try the gnocchi and ended up going with the chef's whim 6 course tasting menu, but requested the gnocchi as one of the courses. Having the chef deliver and describe each of his creations shows his passion for the food. The meal started with smoked bluefish which was delicate and presented perfectly. The next course was hamachi crudo which was my second favorite with a balanced sweetness from Meyer lemons and a surprise with the inclusion of chili oil. This was followed by foie gras which was a little salty until mixed with the quince and cocoa. The potato gnocchi was my favorite and worth waiting for. This dish was a contrast in textures and deep flavors. The rainbow trout was tender with a crispy skin and as much as I like bacon, it felt unnecessary. I was excited to try the NY strip steak which was cooked sous vide and then seared. While it was cooked well, it was missing the deep sear I prefer in a steak. The meal was completed with baked doughnuts which were delicious. It feels like the restaurant and chef are using different influences and techniques to showcase their food, but are still trying to find a true identity. They have a small, cozy interior except for the large plate glass on one wall where the fluorescent street lights shine through. Overall it was a very good experience and I look forward to returning and experiencing more of their ever changing menu.

We had a wonderful dinner. We chose the 4-course menu and we're delighted that we did. Everything from the warm bread they served with butter and olive oil to the Caesar salad, the fresh pastas (the pasta with smoked clams is fantastic) to the duck with chanterelle mushrooms and the trout was perfectly cooked and beautifully served. We both loved our desserts, also, mint chip ice cream and an Italian version of a strawberry shortcake. Looking forward to going back. Street parking is very easy.

Visiting from Montreal, stopped for the night. Very good surprise, everything was great: top service, creative dishes, small cozy ambiance. We were with our 2 year old daughter and everyone was respectful and down to earth.

Four stars for food - very good, not the best Italian in the city (see Giulia and Pammy's). Two stars for service - slow, never got cocktails we ordered. Overall, feels overpriced for what you get but nothing was egregious.

Small menu of great homemade pastas and entrees. Everything we had was excellent, including the cocktails, bread and espresso. You can't really go wrong with any of the pastas. Place is small, but has a nice ambiance.
Smaller plates of high quality food. Consistently good.

Really nice place to eat. The octopus starter was good but the burrata crostini was a bit smoky. The gnocchi was very good and we liked the actual  pasta a lot, the sauce on the pasta course was good but not great. Our favorite part of the meal was the entrees. The bass was excellent and was served over an awesome pea salad dish. The steak was also fabulous and came with these amazing fried potato gratin cube things, they were really awesome. We got two desserts, blackberry panna Cotta was not good. The actual panna cotta was bland and completely overwhelmed by a champagne topping. The white chocolate semifredo with strawberry gelato was incredible!!!! One of the best desserts I’ve had in a long time.  Really great service and all around really nice experience.
We tried everything on the menu except dessert.  Really fun creative dishes that are very reasonable priced.

My girlfriend and I went to the Fat Hen over the weekend, after I had seen good reviews and been intrigued by the menu. We had very differing experiences. Her first course was a ravioli that tasted amazing but consisted of only 4 tiny raviolis for $17. Her second course centered around a steak, which they did not ask her how she wanted it prepared and it came out very rare. We took that to go and I grilled it more (to medium) and it tasted very good. I had the rabbit gnocci and the braised short ribs. Both tasted excellent and I had no complaints. I also had a Negroni cocktail which was amazing. 3 stars is a mix of mine and my girlfriends experiences.
Amazing experience, some of the most delicious and creative Italian dishes and superb staff. I recommend getting more Google reviews to rank higher in search - well deserved.
Amazing food, value, and ambiance

great little gem in Sommerville! sit about 30 people so it's a very intimate space. the value is good - $45 per person will get you a solid 4-course meal. strongly recommend the mushroom fettuccine and the affogato dessert
We got the degustation - veal tongue, rye rigatoni, and dorade. Everything was delicious and the service was outstanding!

Uncluttered menu with straightforward, solid food! Delicious! Pasta portions were generous. Entrees were small but well-composed - e.g. a main protein, a sauce, and vegetable garnish. These entrees seem not to be "big plates," where the protein is often accompanied by a side veg and starch. Still everything was delicious. Desserts were unfussy - usually a main component with a complementing garnish, but perhaps could use one more textural element for crunch. Service was fast and friendly and did not decline when the place filled up.
Food was very good. Service was mediocre. The wait staff only stayed on one side of the long table we had and those on the opposite end had trouble hearing what was being said. Not very professional.

They have a variety of Pasta, Antipasta, and alternative dishes like swordfish or pork shoulder. They have a great spread and an opportunity to get a 4-course meal for $45 for each person at the table. Small, intimate space, perfect for a dinner for two. We went as a group of 6 and had a great time.
Wonderful food, service, and drink menu.
Outstanding food and service

Excellent food, perfect for a nice date night. A weekday hits the spot, you're more likely to be able to walk in without a reservation. The appetizers and pasta were perfect. (The main course was weak in comparison, but at this point I had to admit I'd become more than a bit spoiled in my expectations.) Waitstaff was on point -- attentive and knowledgeable without being solicitous and dealt with what could have become a problem anywhere else with complete grace.
Food is very good but a bit expensive

Great place for a special meal. Five course tasting menu was a memorable experience. The dining room is very small, with a spare, modern feel. Service was good and the reservations help from Kelly was excellent. I am eager go back.

We had a good dinner there in Dec 2016, starting with drinks at the La Brasa bar while we waited for our table.  You should get a reservation.  Attentive staff.  Fat Hen is a small space separated from La Brasa.  The table was a little bit small so our dishes sometimes crowded our table.  I wished there was a little more lighting to better read our menus and admire the presentation of our dishes.
Absolutely first class, waitstaff, service, food, wine, ambiance! Treat yourself if you're a foodie. Doesn't get much better in Boston or Italy!

Absolutely delicious!! Four of us went and all got the prix fixe menu. This option allows you to choose from among all of the choices for each course so we all ended up ordering different items. Everything was excellent. I had the stuffed mushrooms (the chanterelles were delicious!),  the tagliatelle with cauliflower and chickpeas, and grilled salmon. The sommelier knew her wines and was very interesting to talk to - her recommendation was spot on. Can't wait to go back!
Unique and interesting menu. Small but rich plates of food. Very tasty

Fat Hen requires that you hold a reservation with a credit card and it is charged $50 per person should you make any changes or not show.  As a result, they have lost me as a customer.  Fat Hen is not as precious as it believes.  There are a lot of great restaurants that are just as great and do not take such liberties.
Small cute restaurant with a short but delicious dinner. The tortellini in brodo was to die for! Good service too!
Absolutely delicious dinner and thoughtful service. The saddle of lamb was perfectly prepared, succulent and unbelievably tasty. Can't wait to return.
